This file should be formatted as a PDF, and is not required for all scholarships. Click submit when finished.

Meghan V Dowling Memorial Scholarship

Please submit an essay that answers the following:
• What area of study do you plan on pursuing after graduation from region 15?
• What are your career goals within the field?
• Why have you chosen a career path working with children/youth?
• How will you contribute to the lives of others through this profession?
• Do you have any community service experience working with children or youth you would like to highlight?

John Mudry Scholarship

Should include how Pomperaug High School has impacted them
Essay Selections:
- Describe a challenge or a struggle you have faced and tell how you were able to address and overcome it.
- How has participation in sports been beneficial to your personal, academic, and emotional growth?
- Why is community service important? How has it personally affected you and your goals and what role do you hope to play in it in the future?
- Write an essay describing your major/career direction. Include any abilities, interests, experiences, employment or clubs you have had that have affected your direction. If you are undecided, indicate why.

King Solomon's Lodge No. 7 Masonic Scholarship

Freemasonry is the oldest fraternity in the world and exists in most countries. Freemasons regulate their lives as builders by helping their fellow man, helping those less fortunate and serving their communities. During your High School years, what have you done to help your fellow man, help those less fortunate and serve your community?
Essay Selections:
- Explain the importance of citizenship and how you’ve participated in citizenship
- Why is community service important? How has it personally affected you and your goals and what role do you hope to play in it in the future?
- Write an essay describing your major/career direction. Include any abilities, interests, experiences, employment or clubs you have had that have affected your direction. If you are undecided, indicate why.

Linda Hughes Scholarship

The Pink Chair Project

The Pink Chair Project is a non-profit breast cancer organization founded by a breast cancer survivor who recognized a need in her community and stepped up to offer assistance. In 500 words or less, write about one important way you have stepped up during your high school years to support someone or some group that benefitted from your help.
